page.title: 16Fishing in Dale
page.content: Fishing is done mainly by amateurs, some of whom are great experts, using several different methods. There are two large boats, registered form Milford Haven, the Castle Bay of Dale and the Garlandstone, which are used for commercial fishing. Six smaller ones are used mainly as fishing boats with others used for occaional fishing. The large boats fish for lobsters and crabs by putting down pots chiefly round the offshore islands. Other pot are put down arount the coast in our area, by amateurs. Nets are also put out in the sheltered bay of Dale, mainly for catching herring and mullet. A popular method of fishing is by rod and line from an anchored boat. In the area dogfish, pollack and mackrell can be caught in this way; and from further afield, skate, ray, turbot and tope are landed
